objects.name: Cherry (Prunus spp.)
objects.text: The cherry tree is known for its beautiful blossoms and edible fruit.

objects.name: Elderberry (Sambucus spp.)
objects.text: Elderberries are valued for their medicinal properties and culinary uses.

objects.name: Bamboo (Bambusoideae family)
objects.text: Bamboo is a fast-growing grass known for its versatility and strength.

objects.name: Holly (Ilex aquifolium)
objects.text: Holly is often associated with Christmas decor due to its vibrant red berries.

objects.name: Horse Chestnut (Aesculus hippocastanum)
objects.text: Horse chestnut trees are known for their large, showy flower clusters.

objects.name: Willow (Salix spp.)
objects.text: Willows thrive near water and are known for their flexible branches.

objects.name: Magnolia (Magnolia spp.)
objects.text: Magnolias are celebrated for their large, fragrant flowers.

objects.name: Rubber Plant (Ficus elastica)
objects.text: The rubber plant is popular as an indoor houseplant for its glossy leaves.

objects.name: Laurel (Laurus nobilis)
objects.text: Laurel is often used as a culinary herb and symbolizes victory.

objects.name: Dogwood (Cornus spp.)
objects.text: Dogwoods are known for their stunning spring flowers and unique bark.

objects.name: Sycamore (Platanus spp.)
objects.text: Sycamores are large trees known for their distinctive peeling bark.

objects.name: Bittercress (Cardamine spp.)
objects.text: Bittercress is often found in moist environments and can be eaten.

objects.name: Peach (Prunus persica)
objects.text: Peach trees are known for their sweet fruits and beautiful blossoms.

objects.name: Linden (Tilia spp.)
objects.text: Linden trees are favored for their fragrant flowers and shade.

objects.name: Cabbage (Brassica oleracea)
objects.text: Cabbage is a versatile vegetable used in various cuisines around the world.

objects.name: Avocado (Persea americana)
objects.text: Avocado is prized for its creamy fruit, rich in healthy fats.

objects.name: Persimmon (Diospyros spp.)
objects.text: Persimmons are sweet fruits that are enjoyed fresh or dried.

objects.name: Citrus (Citrus spp.)
objects.text: Citrus trees are known for their juicy fruits and aromatic leaves.

objects.name: Redbud (Cercis canadensis)
objects.text: Redbuds are celebrated for their stunning pink flowers in early spring.

objects.name: Sweetheart (Cercis canadensis)
objects.text: Sweetheart trees are often admired for their heart-shaped leaves.

objects.name: Himalayan Balsam (Impatiens glandulifera)
objects.text: Himalayan Balsam is known for its beautiful flowers and rapid growth.

objects.name: Burdock (Arctium spp.)
objects.text: Burdock is often used in traditional medicine and for culinary purposes.

objects.name: Arum (Arum spp.)
objects.text: Arum plants are known for their unique flower structures and foliage.

objects.name: Butterfly Bush (Buddleja spp.)
objects.text: Butterfly Bush attracts butterflies with its fragrant flowers.

objects.name: Cinnamon (Cinnamomum verum)
objects.text: Cinnamon is valued for its aromatic bark and culinary uses.

objects.name: Mugwort (Artemisia vulgaris)
objects.text: Mugwort is often used in herbal medicine and cooking.

objects.name: Chinese Water Chestnut (Eleocharis dulcis)
objects.text: Chinese Water Chestnut is a popular ingredient in Asian cuisine.
